title: Mount Ararat (Pennsylvania)
text:
Mount Ararat is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> located in the <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a> villages of <a href="Mount%20Pleasant%20Township%2C%20Wayne%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania%23Communities">Belmont Corners</a> and <a href="Orson%2C%20Pennsylvania">Orson</a>. Its summit, which is in Orson, is the highest point in <a href="Wayne%20County%2C%20Pennsylvania">Wayne County, Pennsylvania</a>, and one of the higher points in eastern <a href="Pennsylvania">Pennsylvania</a>. Mount Ararat is located in the <a href="Glaciated%20Allegheny%20Plateau">Glaciated Low Plateaus</a> geological section of Pennsylvania. This section is characterized with low rolling hills and modest relief. This summit is of low relief but stands as a peak above the countryside.
The west and north sides of Mount Ararat drain into the East Branch of the <a href="Lackawanna%20River">Lackawanna River</a>, thence into the <a href="Susquehanna%20River">Susquehanna River</a>, and into <a href="Chesapeake%20Bay">Chesapeake Bay</a>. The east side of Ararat drains into the West Branch of the <a href="Lackawaxen%20River">Lackawaxen River</a>, thence into the <a href="Delaware%20River">Delaware River</a>, and into <a href="Delaware%20Bay">Delaware Bay</a>.
